GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
bors merge

Thanks! Though I'm kind of surprised that you actually need this lemma

> Thanks! Though I'm kind of surprised that you actually need this lemma

honestly I don't anymore after a refactor, but it seems plausible that I'll need it soon so it doesn't hurt for sure, thanks for the review!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8210092697/job/22456904727)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8210092697/job/22456904646)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8210092697/job/22456904546)
If you put this on line 95, the proof is `equivToOpposite.surjective`
is that a reason not to include this in the first place (which would be fine) or is there some defeq reason to rewrite it into the equiv version?
I think there's still a weak reason relating to defeq that justifies it existing.
Rewrote both, the other one via `symm`, hope that's fine

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/Opposite): Show that op, unop are surjective

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Category/RelCat): Show basic facts and self-duality of category of relations.
